meanings.definition: To collect or gather into a mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: She is aggregating all her toys into one big pile.
meanings.sent2: The students are aggregating their data for the science project.
meanings.sent3: The ants are aggregating food for their queen.
meanings.sent4: The team is aggregating their efforts to win the championship.
meanings.sent5: The farmer is aggregating his crops for market day.

meanings.definition: To combine or unite into a single entity.
meanings.sent1: The chef is aggregating the ingredients to make a delicious soup.
meanings.sent2: The company is aggregating its subsidiaries to form a larger corporation.
meanings.sent3: The birds are aggregating to migrate south for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The artist is aggregating colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The team is aggregating their skills to tackle the project together.

meanings.sent1: The cashier is aggregating the prices of the items in the shopping cart.
meanings.sent2: The accountant is aggregating the expenses for the quarterly report.
meanings.sent3: The children are aggregating their scores to see who won the game.
meanings.sent4: The scientist is aggregating the data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher is aggregating the points for the final grades.
